annotation.TEXT: And here is the final manipulation - fly guy is now in place! At this point, we need to get onto the ship, which means lakitu is going to play an important role. This whole time, I've deliberately put up with his harassing me just so I could use him for this.
Now, I use vertical speed conservation + lakitu bounce + ground pound to get up onto the ship platform. I could also have grabbed onto the platform, but ground pounding was quicker.
I also destroy the box. The box's platform will be highly used in a bit while I'm under heavy time pressure, and so I can't have it obstructing me.

Notice that I hug the right edge as I move so as to not reactivate fly guy prematurely. Additionally, I constantly dive and dive recover so as not to stay at ground level too long, otherwise fly guy's lunge would end.
Let me know if you like the annotations. Normally I don't like adding text to ABC videos because it distracts from the gameplay, but this way there's the option to watch with and without the text.

Look at him over there. Now that he's deactivated, he won't follow me up, so I can ride the carpet to get above him and eventually bounce on him. I just have to make sure not to stay on the carpet as it moves closest to him, otherwise I could prematurely reactivate him.
I'm including annotations in this video to help explain what's going on. If you don't want annotations or find them distracting, feel free to turn them off.
Ironically, now that I've gone down here, I need to lure him away anyway so that I can use him to get off the top of this pole. Otherwise, I can't get back to the mainland of the course.
The carpet ride itself is pretty trivial. Fly guy is too far away to accidentally reactivate and the carpet is now high enough so that I don't have to worry about having the lunge end.

Now I begin climbing the ship's mast. Being at the bottom of the mast reactivates fly guy, who proceeds to spin upwards in the background. By strategically climbing up and down, I further manipulate fly guy, putting him into spins and lunges in just the right way so that he flies into the top of the pole. I also kill this lakitu because he was majorly obstructing my ability to climb freely.

Okay, so now fly guy has successfully been transported to the red coin maze. This position is as close as I can get fly guy to the ship while also Mario is able to get to the next carpet ride without inadvertently activating fly guy and Mario is able to activate fly guy from the big house's carpet. So now, I use this setup to perform one last fly guy manipulation to put him into a lunging state towards the ship.

Now I can't walk at all or I'd lose the vertical speed. Luckily, the vertical speed will activate itself right where I need it, i.e. at the blue bar. Thus, I can wait on the blue bar for the carpet to go ahead, while I stay behind to delay lakitu's reactivation. Normally, I'd deactivate lakitu during the first carpet ride as well to further delay his ascent, but I couldn't do that while also manipulating fly guy. Thus, I needed to resort to this technique to get a few extra precious seconds.

So now I show a generic fly guy manipulation, as I put him into a lunging state towards the red coin maze. If you watch closely, you can follow the steps. First, I dive recover from the carpet to the octagon plaform, putting fly guy into a spinning state. Then at a specific moment, I go back down onto the blue block and back up to stop fly guy at just the right angle, i.e. towards the red coin maze. Once this is done, I can't go too low or the spin will come to a stop and fly guy will just turn back towards his starting position and try to go there.

Note that this height situation doesn't parallel the last one. That is, I can't perpetuate fly guy's lunge by diving and dive recovering on the platforms below, because they're too low and so not even a dive recover can go high enough. If I stay on the carpet ride, fly guy will maintain the lunge, but once I drop down, I'll have a finite amount of time to get to fly guy's activation range before his lunge ends, since I can't postpone it once I drop down.
So, the first thing I need to do is lure fly guy out of his starting position. This is because fly guy needs to be 2000+ units away from his home to be manipulated.

So by repeating this process over and over, I move fly guy horizontally while keeping his vertical position constant. This is necessary because I have him at a very specific height that facilitates this process. You see, the rotating platforms that I run on are JUST low enough to have fly guy's lunge end. Consequently, by diving and dive recovering on these platforms, I can be high enough to maintain fly guy's lunge indefinitely. This is helpful because it gives me sufficient time to get over to fly guy's activation radius while he's still in a lunge and then I can have the lunge end on command simply by staying on the ground.

Now here's the thing. If I just let fly guy lunge towards the red coin maze, he'd be way too high by the time he got there, and there's no way to lower him efficiently. Thus, what I do is reactivate fly guy right at the end of his lunge, i.e. when he ceases moving upwards and turns back towards his home. Since he makes a wide turn, he effectively moves horizontally without actually moving vertically. And of course, I deactivate fly guy before he has time to move back towards his starting position.

So first, I allow lakitu to drop back down to this level, since he was still high up from when I rode the carpet ride. Then, I start the carpet at a specific time (to be explained in a bit), and then I simultaneously activate one of fly guy's spins while also manipulating lakitu to fly far away so that I can deactivate him before he flies up too far.

And from here, it's a simple matter of luring chuckya over and having him throw me into the star. And there we have it - one of the least likely to save A presses has now been saved! Get rekt Rainbow Ride!

Thus, what I do is ride out the carpet until I'm sufficiently close to the platform that had the box. Remember when I destroyed it? That was for this technique! Once I'm close enough, I ZB down to it and then reactivate fly guy right at the end of his lunge, thereby moving him horizontally.
Now, my goal is to transport fly guy towards the red coin maze by manipulating him. To make this easier, I first deactivate fly guy as close to the maze as I can.

Once fly guy has been manipulated just right, I head to the top of the pole myself and have him knock into me while causing me to bounce on him and twirl. The twirl's slow descent combined with the initial momentum of the knock back are just enough for Mario to reach the island.

Now, remember what I said about starting the carpet at a specific time? It's about to become evident. I needed the carpet's timing to match up with these rotating bridges so that I could dive recover from the bridge to the carpet to maintain 26 vertical speed.
Right now fly guy is in a lunging state towards the red coin maze. So I reactivate fly guy and deactivate him right when he reaches a particular height.

And now, like before, I repeat this maneuver over and over to transport fly guy. This time, I'm transporting him to behind the ship. Interestingly, this transportation is faster than the other one, because fly guy is moving parallel to his starting point rather than directly away from it. This means I can have him use a larger portion of his wide turn before I deactivate him. I also have to make sure not to move him too far away (since I wouldn't be able to reactivate him) or too close (since I wouldn't be able to deactivate him and he'd go all the way back home). Thus, I need to maintain him at just the right distance.

Now that he's deactivated, I begin the manipulation process. This is a rather confusing process, so click here to learn more about it. Otherwise, here's the basics. Mario's relative height to fly guy can be used to change fly guy's state. Specifically, if Mario ascends quickly with correct timing and RNG, fly guy can enter a spinning state. Additionally, Mario can then go back down and up quickly to stop fly guy's spin at a particular angle, and fly guy will be in a lunging state in that direction. Fly guy will maintain this lunging/spinning state until Mario goes down too far relative to fly guy.

Now I go onto the big house's carpet to reactivate fly guy and have him lunge up to this level. Once again, I stop him at a particular height that will facilitate in manipulating him. Specifically, from this height I can manipulate him as follows. I can climb from the bottom of the pole upwards to put fly guy into a spin, then drop down and back up to stop him at a particular angle. I need to do this all quickly so that I can drop down onto the carpet before it passes by.
